results.title: Interpretations
results.creator_credit: Educational Film Studio and Film Polski
results.brief_description: This film looks at the creative process of painting as it is revealed in three individual painters. The three painters gather to look at a simple, traditional subject - a woman standing in a boat as the sun rises over the lake. From this we follow the individual creative process in each painter as he recreates the scene in his own imagination. Strikingly different in interpretation, each painting presents a valid statement of the artist’s vision of reality. No dialogue, english titles. (An edited version of the film “Interpretacle”.)

results.title: Interplanetary space
results.creator_credit: Bruce N. Gregory, Hugh Odishaw, Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Traces the development of space travel. Explains the importance of radar and radio astronomy in arriving at the conclusion about the activity of the Sun, its planets and some of the minor members of the solar system. considers them within the milieu of interplanetary space, a region now recognised to be an environment suffused with ionizing radiations, magnetic forces, gravitational influences, cosmic rays and the solar wind.

results.title: International youth year
results.creator_credit: Department of Youth, Sport and Recreation and Open Channel Productions
results.brief_description: A discussion starter about problems and issues facing young people. Looks at cultural understanding and racism, technological change and consumerism, apprenticeship rights, single mothers, alcoholism and drug dependence, authority, nuclear disarmament, student participation, homelessness, disabled people and unemployment.

results.title: International Monetary System
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Economics”.
An historically detailed understanding of the international monetary system. Covers the Bretton Woods system with its features; role of the US dollar, International Monetary Fund, performance, problems and final collapse. Follows on after Bretton Woods system with the managed float era, pressure and problems, issues and possible reforms to the international monetary system.

results.title: Intern: a long year
results.creator_credit: Michael Livesey, Robert Johnson, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The year a doctor spends as an intern may seem routine to someone not in the medical profession. But for an intern it is a kaliedoscopic experience: the cases once studied only in textbooks become living patients. It is a difficult year for most interns, including Dr Karen Mack, the subject of this film.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Michael Livesey, Robert Johnson, John Barnes and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Intermezzo
results.creator_credit: David Buckan, John Cox, BBC-TV and Glyndebourne
results.brief_description: Intermezzo by Richard Strauss is an autobiographical opera based on the real life relationship between Richard Strauss and his wife Pauline using the characters Robert and Christine Storch. Set in the 1920s, the central plot involves an innocent flirtation by the lonely and bored Christine (Felicity Lott) with the charming, but penniless, Baron Lummer (Ian Caley) whilst her composer husband Robert (John Pringle) is away on an official visit to Vienna. However life becomes complicated when an unexpected letter is delivered to Christine, the contents of which lead her to suspect her husband of having an illicit affair. This is an opera of comedy and wit with a blend of talking and singing, told in 14 scenes with symphonic interludes. Costume and set designs are lavish and stylish and very art nouveau authentically recreating the era and atmosphere of the times. Features the London Philharmonic Orchestra conducted by Gustav Kuhn and supporting cast including Elizabeth Gale in the role of Anna, the chambermaid.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Buckan, John Cox, BBC-TV and Glyndebourne

results.title: Intermediate tumbling
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Tumbling”.
This film demonstrates the kip, rolling kip, headspring, handspring, thigh stand, shoulder mount, shoulder dive, lift and toss, back to back pullover, back over feet, front over neck, foot to pelvis somersault, and hand-spring over back.
